image.altText: A gold sedan bogged in a snow bank, with a police vehicle behind it in the dark.

props.synopsis: ACT Policing Rural Patrol Senior Constable Angus Fergusson says when heading into cold conditions people should wear appropriate clothing, bring food and water, let someone know where you're going, and carry navigation equipment and a personal locator beacon.

title.children: Emergency services agencies urge weather preparedness after three Canberra region bush rescues in a month

image.altText: a person holding a rainbow flag

props.synopsis: It is a threat many in the queer community thought was subsiding, albeit slowly, but recent events show that the danger of homophobic violence in Australia is proving to be even more pernicious.

title.children: Despite significant progress the threat of homophobic violence lingers stubbornly in Australia

image.altText: People lying inside saunas floating on a lake.

props.synopsis: Visitors and locals could soon be jumping into the icy cold waters of Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin from two floating saunas. Detailed designs and plans have been released for feedback, with hopes to have them operational by summer.

title.children: If you can't take the heat, prime minister, you can soon go jump in the lake

image.altText: An Aboriginal flag blows in the wind, with bushes and pink flowers in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The ACT government proudly labels itself as progressive and was the only jurisdiction in Australia to vote for the Voice to Parliament in the referendum. So, how does Australia's capital fare when graded on the quality of life of its First Nations people?Â

title.children: 'We need to change the way we do business': First Nations youth incarceration rate rises

image.altText: A man stands next to a woman.

props.synopsis: The second day of the Garma festival is kicking off in north-east Arnhem Land, with the NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy set to deliver an apology to the Indigenous community. Follow live.

title.children: NT police commissioner to make apology to Indigenous community

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Why the commissioner's apology will matter
BREAKING: NT police commissioner to make apology to Indigenous community

image.altText: gioldoglodgold

props.synopsis: Australia has won three gold medals in a stunning morning at the Paris Olympics, with victories in the pool to Cam McEvoy and Kaylee McKeown, and an historic BMX win for Saya Sakakibara.

title.children: Australian gold rush in Paris as McEvoy, McKeown and Sakakibara create history at the Olympics

image.altText: A small child dancing in the sand with adults watching in the background.

props.synopsis: Amid shifting sands in Indigenous affairs, young leaders are drawing strength from their culture to stand firm.

title.children: A young boy dances in the pit at Garma as sands shift in Indigenous leadership

image.altText: A view of the coast in Beirut during summer time, which shows a bleu beach and greenery.

props.synopsis: Australians in Lebanon say they've been left "stranded" trying to exit Lebanon amid renewed advice from the federal government to evacuate the country. But many say they've been left in the dark after being told the airport is closed.

title.children: 'Stranded' Australians holidaying in Lebanon say they can't get home amid evacuation orders

image.altText: croweater on hill

props.synopsis: Australia joins the list of worldwide locations where Active Clubs have been established. Experts say white supremacy groups like this are a threat to our social cohesion.Â

title.children: Not sports clubs: 'Active Clubs' are threatening social cohesion in Australia, expert says

image.altText: A black sign with 'CFMEU Victoria' written on it, hanging on a construction site.

props.synopsis: Construction bosses and building industry whistleblowers fearful of retribution will be free to speak out against the CFMEU under cover of a potential parliamentary inquiry amid concern existing workplace regulators lack investigative teeth and protections.

title.children: Fair Work takeover of CFMEU 'not enough' say critics calling for greater witness protections

image.altText: A man stands in a glass box as people take photos of him.

props.synopsis: One of the largest and most complex prisoner swaps since the Cold War was almost derailed by a shocking death, competing global agendas, and a US president's fading political ambitions.Â

title.children: A painstaking, top-secret prisoner swap was almost done. Then came a mysterious death

image.altText: A close up of the front of a small plane with a sunset behind

props.synopsis: Rex knew it was being ambitious when it expanded into capital city services after Virgin Australia found itself in trouble in 2020. Little did it know that four years later, Virgin would be the very company coming to its aid.Â

title.children: When Rex Airlines entered the Golden Triangle, it accused competitors of 'slot hoarding'. But what is it?

image.altText: A composite image of a man in a puffer jacket, skiers, and a foot in socks over a fire

props.synopsis: The word on the street seems unanimous â it feels like one of the coldest winters in living memory.

title.children: Australia shivers through June and July, so was the BOM's forecast of a warm winter wrong?

image.altText: A close-up head and shoulders shot of Linda Reynolds arriving at court in Perth wearing glasses and a black jacket and top.

props.synopsis: The first day in the high-stakes trial in the WA Supreme Court has seen Linda Reynolds lawyer pick apart several claims by Brittany Higgins after she reported being raped in Parliament House.

title.children: What we learned from the first day of Linda Reynolds' defamation trial against Brittany Higgins

image.altText: Anna at her gate close crop

props.synopsis: Anna reached adulthood believing she was an orphan. Then the truth came out.

title.children: 'I believe I was human trafficked': this Melbourne woman discovered her history was a lie

image.altText: hands holding Australian cash notes

props.synopsis: New data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics shows household spending has fallen by 0.5 per cent for June after two consecutive rises.

title.children: Australians households are spending less. Here's what they're cutting back on

image.altText: Saya

props.synopsis: After her historic BMX gold medal, Saya Sakakibara pays tribute to her family and reveals she had COVID earlier in the week.

title.children: Sakakibara fights back tears as she pays tribute to her family and reveals she had COVID before historic BMX gold

image.altText: Kaylee McKeown

props.synopsis: With her 200m backstroke title defence Kaylee McKeown becomes the first Australian to win four individual Olympic golds, while Cam McEvoy shatters the disappointment of Rio with Paris gold.

title.children: McKeown becomes first Aussie to win four individual Olympic golds, as McEvoy puts Rio disappointment behind him

image.altText: Saya Sakakibara holds her head and cries

props.synopsis: Saya Sakakibara has endured things as an athlete that many would ever recover from â but her Olympic gold medal is a testament to her strength, and that of her entire family.

title.children: The happy tears of Sakakibara's Olympic gold are a testament to her endurance in the face of adversity

image.altText: Kaylee McKeown holds her hands on her head and looks up after a race

props.synopsis: Kaylee McKeown's rare Olympic "double-double" means she stands alone in Australian swimming history, but even without the records she will be remembered as one of the sport's most unique champions.Â

title.children: Unique, resilient, legendary â Kaylee McKeown has taken Australian swimming into uncharted Olympic waters

image.altText: Dyson Daniels of Australia holds his knee after slipping on the court.

props.synopsis: The Boomers are through to the men's basketball quarterfinals after results go their way, while the Stingers and Gangurrus are assured of advancing from the group stage after their respective wins in the women's water polo and 3x3 basketball.

title.children: Boomers avoid early Games exit, Stingers earn quarterfinal berth with win over Canada

image.altText: A tall blonde woman in a beige wrap dress surrounded by artworks: blue stacked totems and a brass wall hanging behind her

props.synopsis:
Clementine Stoney Maconachie made her Olympic debut in the pool at the Sydney 2000 Games. More than two decades later, she's in Paris as an Olympian Artist.

Â

title.children: Illness ended this Australian swimmer's career. Now she's at the Olympics as an artist

image.altText: Jo Canham stands in a dark coat in a row of books at her store

props.synopsis: At its height, Booktopia posted a package every 3.9 seconds to millions of Australians. Now, some independent bookshops hope its collapse will lead to a boost in business.

title.children: How Booktopia's collapse could help your favourite bricks-and-mortar bookshop

image.altText: Collingwood AFL player Scott Pendlebury looks for a teammate to handpass to while on his knees

props.synopsis: Ahead of game 400, the ABC explores whether Scott Pendleburyâs reputation for being the AFLâs most consistent and effective player is supported by the data.

title.children: Scott Pendlebury is a footy outlier and here's the proof

image.altText: A bowl of vegetarian kimchi jjigae with mushroom and tofu (kimchi stew) topped with green spring onion.

props.synopsis: This Korean-inspired spicy tofu stew by Hetty Lui McKinnon makes for a quick weeknight meal.Â

title.children: Kimchi adds instant flavour to this spicy vegetarian stew

image.altText: Steven May is helped off the ground by a trainer

props.synopsis: Melbourne is sweating on scans on Steven May's ribs after the star defender was forced out of Friday night's horror loss to the Western Bulldogs in the second quarter.

title.children: Melbourne star Steven May sent to hospital after 'incredibly disappointing' loss to Western Bulldogs

image.altText: A man runs the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: After 11 tries, 74 points, a sin bin and some moments of Sam Walker brilliance, the Roosters snuck home 40-34 against the Dolphins in Perth.Â

title.children: Sam Walker dazzles as Roosters sneak home against Dolphins in 74-point thriller

image.altText: Large entrances and cut-outs open the home up to the garden outside.

props.synopsis: The home opens up into a lush backyard, providing relief from the Queensland heat while giving the feel of more room inside.

title.children: House of the Year winner proves bigger isn't always better, with room for family and work under one roof

image.altText: A woman dressed in business attire sits in an office looking towards someone elevated in the foreground.

props.synopsis: In her first sit-down interview, NSW rental commissioner Trina Jones told the ABC a scheme to digitally transfer bonds between rental properties was not on the cards for 2024.

title.children: NSW rental commissioner pushes ahead with 'divisive' pet reforms

image.altText: Six stuffed cane toads on small wooden mounts, some drinking, some smoking, one fishing.

props.synopsis: A handful of Australians have gone to extremes to transform cane toads into useful products â and some of their methods are tough to stomach.

title.children: They eat them, stuff them and even wear them. They're the Australians with an eccentric approach to cane toads

image.altText: A restaurant with tables, chairs, large vase and green plant.

props.synopsis: Prahran-based eatery Little Tim Tam has pleaded guilty to food safety breaches after being pursued for two years by the local council.

title.children: Melbourne restaurant Little Tim Tam fined after cockroaches and rodent droppings found in kitchen

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man in a gingham shirt

props.synopsis: Mr Navalny, the fiercest political foe of Russian President Vladimir Putin, died in February in an Arctic penal colony while serving a 19-year sentence on extremism charges.

title.children: Former Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was meant to be included in prisoner swap

props.synopsis: From the pool to River Seine, see the magical moments for athletes from week one of the Games.Â

title.children: The most stunning images from the 2024 Paris Olympics
